Herman Melville - Moby-Dick

Availing himself of the mild, summer-cool weather that now reigned in these latitudes, and in preparation for the peculiarly active pursuits shortly to be anticipated, Perth, the begrimed, blistered old blacksmith, had not removed his portable forge to the hold again, after concluding his contributory work for Ahab's leg, but still retained it on deck, fast lashed to ringbolts by the foremast; being now almost incessantly invoked by the headsmen, and harpooneers, and bowsmen to do some little job for them; altering, or repairing, or new shaping their various weapons and boat furniture. Often he would be surrounded by an eager circle, all waiting to be served; holding boat-spades, pike-heads, harpoons, and lances, and jealously watching his every sooty movement, as he toiled. Nevertheless, this old man's was a patient hammer wielded by a patient arm. No murmur, no impatience, no petulance did come from him. Silent, slow, and solemn; bowing over still further his chronically broken back, he toiled away, as if toil were life itself, and the heavy beating of his hammer the heavy beating of his heart. And so it was.—Most miserable! A peculiar walk in this old man, a certain slight but painful appearing yawing in his gait, had at an early period of the voyage excited the curiosity of the mariners. And to the importunity of their persisted questionings he had finally given in; and so it came to pass that every one now knew the shameful story of his wretched fate. Belated, and not innocently, one bitter winter's midnight, on the road running between two country towns, the blacksmith half-stupidly felt the deadly numbness stealing over him, and sought refuge in a leaning, dilapidated barn. The issue was, the loss of the extremities of both feet. Out of this revelation, part by part, at last came out the four acts of the gladness, and the one long, and as yet uncatastrophied fifth act of the grief of his life's drama. He was an old man, who, at the age of nearly sixty, had postponedly encountered that thing in sorrow's technicals called ruin. He had been an artisan of famed excellence, and with plenty to do; owned a house and garden; embraced a youthful, daughter-like, loving wife, and three blithe, ruddy children; every Sunday went to a cheerful-looking church, planted in a grove. But one night, under cover of darkness, and further concealed in a most cunning disguisement, a desperate burglar slid into his happy home, and robbed them all of everything. And darker yet to tell, the blacksmith himself did ignorantly conduct this burglar into his family's heart. It was the Bottle Conjuror! Upon the opening of that fatal cork, forth flew the fiend, and shrivelled up his home. Now, for prudent, most wise, and economic reasons, the blacksmith's shop was in the basement of his dwelling, but with a separate entrance to it; so that always had the young and loving healthy wife listened with no unhappy nervousness, but with vigorous pleasure, to the stout ringing of her young-armed old husband's hammer; whose reverberations, muffled by passing through the floors and walls, came up to her, not unsweetly, in her nursery; and so, to stout Labor's iron lullaby, the blacksmith's infants were rocked to slumber. Oh, woe on woe! Oh, Death, why canst thou not sometimes be timely? Hadst thou taken this old blacksmith to thyself ere his full ruin came upon him, then had the young widow had a delicious grief, and her orphans a truly venerable, legendary sire to dream of in their after years; and all of them a care-killing competency.

data-hpc="true"><article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Stream Deck for Visual Studio Code</h1><a id="user-content-stream-deck-for-visual-studio-code" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Stream Deck for Visual Studio Code" href="#stream-deck-for-visual-studio-code"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Features</h2><a id="user-content-features" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Features" href="#features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Execute any Visual Studio Code command or menu.</li>
<li>Create and execute terminal commands.</li>
<li>Insert snippets.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Getting Started</h2><a id="user-content-getting-started" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Getting Started" href="#getting-started"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Download <em>Visual Studio Code</em> plugin on Stream Deck Store or <a href="https://github.com/nicollasricas/vscode-streamdeck/releases/latest">here</a>.</li>
<li>Download <em>Stream Deck for Visual Studio Code</em> on <a href="https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=nicollasr.vscode-streamdeck" rel="nofollow">Visual Studio Code marketplace</a> or <a href="https://github.com/nicollasricas/vscode-streamdeck/releases/latest">here</a>.</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto">After installing the plugin and the extension you should see this in VSCode status bar:</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7860985/75925951-f97eaa80-5e3f-11ea-8ae2-0a1e7b838380.png"><img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7860985/75925951-f97eaa80-5e3f-11ea-8ae2-0a1e7b838380.png" alt="Connected to Stream Deck" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>If for some reason the focused instance, were not active click on the status bar or alternate between windows to force activation.</strong></p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Only the active session will receive the commands.</strong></p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>If you are connected remotely through SSH, you should add a forward into your SSH config.</strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">RemoteForward 48969 127.0.0.1:48969</p>
</blockquote>
<p dir="auto">Thanks to <strong><a href="https://github.com/rettgerst">rettgerst</a></strong> for pointing this out <a href="https://github.com/nicollasricas/vscode-streamdeck/issues/4#issuecomment-674471109" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/nicollasricas/vscode-deck/issues/4/hovercard">here</a>.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Getting Commands ID</h2><a id="user-content-getting-commands-id" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Getting Commands ID" href="#getting-commands-id"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">In Visual Studio Code open <em>File->Preferences->Keyboard Shortcuts</em>, find the command you want, right-click it and <em>Copy Command Id</em>.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Settings (Optional)</h2><a id="user-content-settings-optional" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Settings (Optional)" href="#settings-optional"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">You can change the IP and port to the message server in the <em>settings.ini</em> file.</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="[general]
host=127.0.0.1
port=48969"><pre class="notranslate"><code>[general]
host=127.0.0.1
port=48969
</code></pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Windows</h4><a id="user-content-windows" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Windows" href="#windows"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><em>%appdata%\Elgato\StreamDeck\Plugins\com.nicollasr.streamdeckvsc.sdPlugin\settings.ini</em></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Mac</h4><a id="user-content-mac" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Mac" href="#mac"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><em>~/Library/Application Support/com.elgato.StreamDeck/Plugins/com.nicollasr.streamdeckvsc.mac.sdPlugin/settings.ini</em></p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>If you changed the server port, don't forget to change it in Visual Studio Code settings or you won't be able to connect and use the available features.</strong></p>
<p dir="auto"><em>I recommend using 127.0.0.1 as your IP address instead of localhost</em>.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Windows WSL2</h4><a id="user-content-windows-wsl2" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Windows WSL2" href="#windows-wsl2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>It is important that <em>%appdata%\Elgato\StreamDeck\Plugins\com.nicollasr.streamdeckvsc.sdPlugin\settings.ini</em> is listening on <code>0.0.0.0</code>:</li>
</ol>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="[general]
host=0.0.0.0
port=48969"><pre class="notranslate"><code>[general]
host=0.0.0.0
port=48969
</code></pre></div>
<ol start="2" dir="auto">
<li>Next, configure <em>~/.vscode-server/data/Machine/settings.json</em> to  the IP address of the Win10 host, as identified by <code>ipconfig /all</code> from a CMD Prompt - e.g.:</li>
</ol>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{
    "streamdeck.serverHost": "192.168.0.25"
}"><pre class="notranslate"><code>{
    "streamdeck.serverHost": "192.168.0.25"
}
</code></pre></div>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">C# library that wraps all the communication with the Stream Deck App, allowing you to focus on actually writing the Plugin's logic.</h4><a id="user-content-c-library-that-wraps-all-the-communication-with-the-stream-deck-app-allowing-you-to-focus-on-actually-writing-the-plugins-logic" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: C# library that wraps all the communication with the Stream Deck App, allowing you to focus on actually writing the Plugin's logic." href="#c-library-that-wraps-all-the-communication-with-the-stream-deck-app-allowing-you-to-focus-on-actually-writing-the-plugins-logic"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Stream Deck+ Support</h1><a id="user-content-stream-deck-support" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Stream Deck+ Support" href="#stream-deck-support"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Instead of <code>PluginBase</code>, Derive from either <code>KeypadBase</code> (if you don't support dials), <code>EncoderBase</code> (for only dials), <code>KeyAndEncoderBase</code> (for both keys and dials)</p>

<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://github.com/BarRaider/streamdeck-tools/raw/master/utils/StreamDeck-Tools%20Template.vsix">StreamDeck-Tools Template</a> for Visual Studio (2019/2022) - Automatically creates a project with all the files needed to compile a plugin. This is the best way to start a new plugin!</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/BarRaider/streamdeck-tools/blob/master/utils/install.bat">Install.bat</a> - Script that quickly uninstalls and reinstalls your plugin on the streamdeck (edit the batch file for more details). Put the install.bat file in your BIN folder (same folder that has Debug/Release sub-folders)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/BarRaider/streamdeck-easypi">EasyPI</a> - Additional library used to easily pass information from the PI (Property Inspector) to your plugin.</li>
<li><a href="https://barraider.com/profiles" rel="nofollow">Profiles</a> Downloadable empty profiles for the XL (32-key), Classic (15-key), Mini (6-key) and Mobile devices at <a href="https://barraider.com/profiles" rel="nofollow">https://barraider.com/profiles</a></li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Library Features</h2><a id="user-content-library-features" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Library Features" href="#library-features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Encapsulates all the communicating with the Stream Deck, getting a plugin working on the Stream Deck only requires implementing the PluginBase class.</li>
<li>Sample plugin now included in this project on Github</li>
<li>Built-in integration with NLog. Use <code>Logger.LogMessage()</code> for logging.</li>
<li>Auto-populate user settings which were modified by the Property Inspector</li>
<li>Access the Global Settings from anywhere in your code</li>
<li>Simplified working with filenames from the Stream Deck SDK.</li>
<li><code>PluginActionId</code> attribute let's you easily associate your code to a specific action defined in the manifest.json</li>
<li>Large set of helper functions to simplify creating images and sending them to the Stream Deck.</li>
</ul>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 6.0</h3><a id="user-content-version-60" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 6.0" href="#version-60"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Merged streamdeck-client-csharp package into library to allow better logging of errors</li>
<li>Added support for SD+ SDK</li>
<li>Increased timeout of connection to Stream Deck due to the Stream Deck taking longer than before to reply on load</li>
<li>Added error catching to prevent 3rd party plugin exception to impact communication</li>
</ol>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 3.2 is out!</h3><a id="user-content-version-32-is-out" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 3.2 is out!" href="#version-32-is-out"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Created new <code>ISDConnection</code> interface which is now implemented by SDConnection and used by PluginAction.</li>
<li>GlobalSettingsManager now has a short delay before calling GetGlobalSettings(), to reduce spamming the Stream Deck SDK.</li>
<li>Updated dependencies to latest version</li>
</ul>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 3.0 is out!</h3><a id="user-content-version-30-is-out" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 3.0 is out!" href="#version-30-is-out"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Updated file handling in <code>Tools.AutoPopulateSettings</code> and <code>Tools.FilenameFromPayload</code> methods</li>
<li>Removed obsolete MD5 functions, use SHA512 functions instead</li>
<li><code>Tools.CenterText</code> function now has optional out <code>textFitsImage</code> value to verify the text does not exceed the image width</li>
<li>New <code>Tools.FormatBytes</code> function converts bytes to human-readable value</li>
<li>New <code>Graphics.GetFontSizeWhereTextFitsImage</code> function helps locate the best size for a text to fit an image on 1 line</li>
<li>Updated dependency packages to latest versions</li>
<li>Bug fix where FileNameProperty attribute</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 2.7 is out!</h3><a id="user-content-version-27-is-out" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 2.7 is out!" href="#version-27-is-out"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>

<p dir="auto">You have to create a new <a href="https://github.com/settings/tokens">Personal Token</a> with the following scopes: <strong>repo:status</strong>, <strong>repo_deployment</strong> and <strong>public_repo</strong>.</p>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How to setup the dev environment</h2><a id="user-content-how-to-setup-the-dev-environment" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: How to setup the dev environment" href="#how-to-setup-the-dev-environment"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Install all the dependencies</li>
</ol>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yarn"><pre>yarn</pre></div>
<ol start="2" dir="auto">
<li>Build the project for the first time, the project uses <a href="https://parceljs.org/" rel="nofollow">Parcel as bundler</a> to handle React and TypeScript</li>
</ol>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yarn build"><pre>yarn build</pre></div>
<ol start="3" dir="auto">
<li>Create a symlink form the folder you clone the repository</li>
</ol>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ln -s devops-streamdeck/dist/dev.santiagomartin.devops.sdPlugin ~/Library/Application\ Support/com.elgato.StreamDeck/Plugins/dev.santiagomartin.devops.sdPlugin"><pre>ln -s devops-streamdeck/dist/dev.santiagomartin.devops.sdPlugin <span class="pl-k">~</span>/Library/Application<span class="pl-cce">\ </span>Support/com.elgato.StreamDeck/Plugins/dev.santiagomartin.devops.sdPlugin</pre></div>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Run the proper dev command, since we are using Parcel to build the project we have a few dev commands to start Parcel in watch mode</li>
</ol>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// For Property Inspector
yarn:dev:pi

// For Plugin
yarn:dev:plugin

// For setup screen, where the user add the configuration for each service
yarn:dev:setup"><pre lang="parcel" class="notranslate"><code>// For Property Inspector
yarn:dev:pi

// For Plugin
yarn:dev:plugin

// For setup screen, where the user add the configuration for each service
yarn:dev:setup
</code></pre></div>

Once saved, the settings are used for all Stream-Deck buttons.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEntity Settings\nContains settings for an individual button.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eHome Assistant Settings\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-home-assistant-settings\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Home Assistant Settings\" href=\"#home-assistant-settings\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eServer URL: \u003ccode\u003ews://your-homeassistant-ip-or-hostname:your-homeassistant-port/api/websocket\u003c/code\u003e, for example (local network) \u003ccode\u003ews://192.126.0.5:8123/api/websocket\u003c/code\u003e or (public, with ssl enabled on default port 443) \u003ccode\u003ewss://my-secure-homeassistant.com/api/websocket\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAccess Token: An long-lived access-token (with admin right) obtained from your Home Assistant. The plugin requires the admin rights, because it uses \"execute-script\" command that is restricted to admin users.\n\u003cem\u003eLong-lived access tokens can be created using the \"Long-Lived Access Tokens\" section at the bottom of a user's Home Assistant profile page.\u003c/em\u003e (Quote from \u003ca href=\"https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/auth_api/#long-lived-access-token\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/auth_api/#long-lived-access-token\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAfter you save your Home Assistant Settings, the plugin will automatically try to connect to your Home Assistant installation. If the connection was successful, the Entity Settings section should allow you to see and configure your entities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDomain: Home Assistant entities are grouped by domains. Select the domain (for example \"switch\") of an entity, you want to configure.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEntity: This is the actual entity you are going to configure (for example \"Kitchen Light\")\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eService: The service will be called when you press the StreamDeck button (green marker at the top right corner).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eService (long press): The service that will be called every time you press and hold the StreamDeck button for more than 300ms (blue marker at the top right corner).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eService Data JSON: JSON formatted data that is sent with your service call when you press a button.\nExample:\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n  \u0026quot;brightness\u0026quot;: 120,\n  \u0026quot;rgb_color\u0026quot;: [255, 0, 0]\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e{\n  \"brightness\": 120,\n  \"rgb_color\": [255, 0, 0]\n}\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\nIf not specified in the JSON, the attribute \u003ccode\u003eentity_id\u003c/code\u003e is being added automatically containing the selected entity's id. You can also specify the target entity_id manually, for example to switch multiple lights at once:\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n  \u0026quot;entity_id\u0026quot;: [\n    \u0026quot;switch.osram_plug_01_bac00b0a_on_off\u0026quot;,\n    \u0026quot;switch.osram_plug_01_87c00a0a_on_off\u0026quot;\n  ],\n  \u0026quot;brightness\u0026quot;: 120,\n  \u0026quot;rgb_color\u0026quot;: [255, 0, 0]\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e{\n  \"entity_id\": [\n    \"switch.osram_plug_01_bac00b0a_on_off\",\n    \"switch.osram_plug_01_87c00a0a_on_off\"\n  ],\n  \"brightness\": 120,\n  \"rgb_color\": [255, 0, 0]\n}\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\nYou can also use \u003ca href=\"https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eJinja2 templates\u003c/a\u003e to dynamically process data based on the states or attributes of your Home Assistant entities. See \u003ca href=\"#Advanced-configuration\"\u003eUsing Jinja2 Templates in Service Data JSON\u003c/a\u003e for more information.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCustom Title:\u003c/strong\u003e Enable to override the main Title of this button. \u003cstrong\u003eYou have to clear the main Title field on top to make this work!\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTitle Template: A \u003ca href=\"https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003enunjucks template\u003c/a\u003e that will be used as the button's title. You can use any of the variables (depending on the selected entity) that are shown below the text-field. For example \u003ccode\u003e{{temperature}}°C\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003e{{friendly_name}}\u003c/code\u003e or (this won't fit the button, but you get the idea) \u003ccode\u003eThe pressure is {{pressure}} and the wind speed is {{wind_speed}}.\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe variable \u003ccode\u003e{{state}}\u003c/code\u003e always contains the \"main state\" of an entity (for example \"on\" and \"off\" for buttons or \"12.4\" for temperature sensors)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe variable \u003ccode\u003e{{unit_of_measurement}}\u003c/code\u003e often contains the ... unit of measurement ... of a sensor's state (for example \"°C\" for a temperature sensor)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCustom Labels:\u003c/strong\u003e Every button can display up to 4 lines of information\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach line in the text-box represents one line on the button\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDepending on if there is an icon or a title for the entity, you may need to leave blank lines in order to not mess up the layout :)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can use \u003ca href=\"https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003enunjucks template\u003c/a\u003e for dynamic content (see above).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAfter you hit the save button, the button should immediately show the new configuration.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" href=\"/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/blob/legacy-3.5.x/doc/custom_labels.png\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/raw/legacy-3.5.x/doc/custom_labels.png\" alt=\"img.png\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUsing Jinja2 Templates in Service Data JSON\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJinja2 Template Integration:\u003c/strong\u003e You can incorporate Jinja2 templates within the Service Data JSON to dynamically\nprocess data based on the states or attributes of your Home Assistant entities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEncapsulation with Raw Tags:\u003c/strong\u003e It's crucial to enclose Jinja2 templates within \u003ccode\u003e{% raw %}\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e{% endraw %}\u003c/code\u003e\ntags. This encapsulation ensures that the StreamDeck plugin processes these templates as Jinja2, distinct from any\nNunjucks templates you might use elsewhere in your configurations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExample of Jinja2 Template Usage:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"  {\n  \u0026quot;temperature\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;{% raw %}{{ state_attr('climate.ff_office_heating','temperature') + 0.5 }}{% endraw %}\u0026quot;\n  }\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e  {\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"temperature\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e{% raw %}{{ state_attr('climate.ff_office_heating','temperature') + 0.5 }}{% endraw %}\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  }\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch1 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eHappy? data-hpc="true"><article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">StreamDeck Home-Assistant Plugin</h1><a id="user-content-streamdeck-home-assistant-plugin" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: StreamDeck Home-Assistant Plugin" href="#streamdeck-home-assistant-plugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 <p dir="auto">The aim of this project is to allow owners of an elgato StreamDeck to control their entities or display sensor data via
their StreamDeck. As the code is very generic, nearly every sensor should work out of the box as well as every
service that does not need any more information but the entity id.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/blob/legacy-3.5.x/doc/example.png"><img src="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/raw/legacy-3.5.x/doc/example.png" alt="img.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Features</h2><a id="user-content-features" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Features" href="#features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Generic functions for any Home Assistant entity</h3><a id="user-content-generic-functions-for-any-home-assistant-entity" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Generic functions for any Home Assistant entity" href="#generic-functions-for-any-home-assistant-entity"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Display state and additional attributes via customizable templates</li>
<li>Call services when a StreamDeck button is pressed (or hold for some time)</li>
</ul>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Manual installation (not recommended)</h3><a id="user-content-manual-installation-not-recommended" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Manual installation (not recommended)" href="#manual-installation-not-recommended"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Download the latest plugin release <a href="https://github.com/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/releases">here</a></li>
<li>Open the downloaded .sdplugin file. It will be automatically installed into your Stream-Deck application
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Note for MacOS users: <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/homeassistant/comments/laq2g4/homeassistant_streamdeck_plugin_dynamic_not_just/glu0zep/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web2x&context=3" rel="nofollow">manual installation steps</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Configuration</h1><a id="user-content-configuration" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Configuration" href="#configuration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">There are two sections on the plugin's configuration panel:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Home Assistant Settings<br>
Contains global settings for your Home Assistant installation. Once saved, the settings are used for all Stream-Deck buttons.</li>
<li>Entity Settings
Contains settings for an individual button.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Home Assistant Settings</h2><a id="user-content-home-assistant-settings" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Home Assistant Settings" href="#home-assistant-settings"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Server URL: <code>ws://your-homeassistant-ip-or-hostname:your-homeassistant-port/api/websocket</code>, for example (local network) <code>ws://192.126.0.5:8123/api/websocket</code> or (public, with ssl enabled on default port 443) <code>wss://my-secure-homeassistant.com/api/websocket</code>.</li>
<li>Access Token: An long-lived access-token (with admin right) obtained from your Home Assistant. The plugin requires the admin rights, because it uses "execute-script" command that is restricted to admin users.
<em>Long-lived access tokens can be created using the "Long-Lived Access Tokens" section at the bottom of a user's Home Assistant profile page.</em> (Quote from <a href="https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/auth_api/#long-lived-access-token" rel="nofollow">https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/auth_api/#long-lived-access-token</a>)</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">After you save your Home Assistant Settings, the plugin will automatically try to connect to your Home Assistant installation. If the connection was successful, the Entity Settings section should allow you to see and configure your entities.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/blob/legacy-3.5.x/doc/ha_settings.png"><img src="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/raw/legacy-3.5.x/doc/ha_settings.png" alt="img_1.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Entity Settings</h2><a id="user-content-entity-settings" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Entity Settings" href="#entity-settings"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Basic configuration</h3><a id="user-content-basic-configuration" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Basic configuration" href="#basic-configuration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Domain: Home Assistant entities are grouped by domains. Select the domain (for example "switch") of an entity, you want to configure.</li>
<li>Entity: This is the actual entity you are going to configure (for example "Kitchen Light")</li>
<li>Service: The service will be called when you press the StreamDeck button (green marker at the top right corner).</li>
<li>Service (long press): The service that will be called every time you press and hold the StreamDeck button for more than 300ms (blue marker at the top right corner).</li>
<li>Service Data JSON: JSON formatted data that is sent with your service call when you press a button.
Example:
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{
  "brightness": 120,
  "rgb_color": [255, 0, 0]
}"><pre class="notranslate"><code>{
  "brightness": 120,
  "rgb_color": [255, 0, 0]
}
</code></pre></div>
If not specified in the JSON, the attribute <code>entity_id</code> is being added automatically containing the selected entity's id. You can also specify the target entity_id manually, for example to switch multiple lights at once:
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{
  "entity_id": [
    "switch.osram_plug_01_bac00b0a_on_off",
    "switch.osram_plug_01_87c00a0a_on_off"
  ],
  "brightness": 120,
  "rgb_color": [255, 0, 0]
}"><pre class="notranslate"><code>{
  "entity_id": [
    "switch.osram_plug_01_bac00b0a_on_off",
    "switch.osram_plug_01_87c00a0a_on_off"
  ],
  "brightness": 120,
  "rgb_color": [255, 0, 0]
}
</code></pre></div>
You can also use <a href="https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/" rel="nofollow">Jinja2 templates</a> to dynamically process data based on the states or attributes of your Home Assistant entities. See <a href="#Advanced-configuration">Using Jinja2 Templates in Service Data JSON</a> for more information.</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/blob/legacy-3.5.x/doc/entity_settings.png"><img src="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/raw/legacy-3.5.x/doc/entity_settings.png" alt="img.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Advanced configuration</h3><a id="user-content-advanced-configuration" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Advanced configuration" href="#advanced-configuration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Custom Title:</strong> Enable to override the main Title of this button. <strong>You have to clear the main Title field on top to make this work!</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Title Template: A <a href="https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html" rel="nofollow">nunjucks template</a> that will be used as the button's title. You can use any of the variables (depending on the selected entity) that are shown below the text-field. For example <code>{{temperature}}°C</code> or <code>{{friendly_name}}</code> or (this won't fit the button, but you get the idea) <code>The pressure is {{pressure}} and the wind speed is {{wind_speed}}.</code>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>The variable <code>{{state}}</code> always contains the "main state" of an entity (for example "on" and "off" for buttons or "12.4" for temperature sensors)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The variable <code>{{unit_of_measurement}}</code> often contains the ... unit of measurement ... of a sensor's state (for example "°C" for a temperature sensor)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Custom Labels:</strong> Every button can display up to 4 lines of information</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto">Each line in the text-box represents one line on the button</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto">Depending on if there is an icon or a title for the entity, you may need to leave blank lines in order to not mess up the layout :)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto">You can use <a href="https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html" rel="nofollow">nunjucks template</a> for dynamic content (see above).</p>
<p dir="auto">After you hit the save button, the button should immediately show the new configuration.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/blob/legacy-3.5.x/doc/custom_labels.png"><img src="/cgiesche/streamdeck-homeassistant/raw/legacy-3.5.x/doc/custom_labels.png" alt="img.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Using Jinja2 Templates in Service Data JSON</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Jinja2 Template Integration:</strong> You can incorporate Jinja2 templates within the Service Data JSON to dynamically
process data based on the states or attributes of your Home Assistant entities.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Encapsulation with Raw Tags:</strong> It's crucial to enclose Jinja2 templates within <code>{% raw %}</code> and <code>{% endraw %}</code>
tags. This encapsulation ensures that the StreamDeck plugin processes these templates as Jinja2, distinct from any
Nunjucks templates you might use elsewhere in your configurations.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Example of Jinja2 Template Usage:</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="  {
  "temperature": "{% raw %}{{ state_attr('climate.ff_office_heating','temperature') + 0.5 }}{% endraw %}"
  }"><pre>  {
  <span class="pl-ent">"temperature"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{% raw %}{{ state_attr('climate.ff_office_heating','temperature') + 0.5 }}{% endraw %}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>
  }</pre></div>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

dir=\"auto\"\u003e✏️ Setup\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-️-setup\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: ✏️ Setup\" href=\"#️-setup\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" and install it. There is a button called \"Toggl\" available in section \"Custom\".\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" href=\"/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/blob/master/resources/readme/PropertyInspector.png\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/raw/master/resources/readme/PropertyInspector.png\" alt=\"PropertyInspector\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTitle\u003c/strong\u003e is a default Stream Deck property available for every button in Stream Deck. You should leave it empty (see Button Label).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAPI Token\u003c/strong\u003e is your private API Token you can get from your \u003ca href=\"https://track.toggl.com/profile\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eToggl profile\u003c/a\u003e. This Token is handled like a password. \u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDon't share it\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/em\u003e. Required.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eButton Label\u003c/strong\u003e is used instead of \u003cem\u003eTitle\u003c/em\u003e. If the tracker isn't running, the Label is shown on the button. If the tracker is running the elapsed time is shown additionally. If \u003cem\u003eTitle\u003c/em\u003e is set, it will override \u003cem\u003eButton Label\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEntry Name\u003c/strong\u003e describes the activity you want to report. It is not required but strongly recommended.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWorkspace\u003c/strong\u003e is your workspace you start the time entries in. Required.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProject\u003c/strong\u003e is the project you want to assign the task to. Leave blank for no project. New projects can be added in Toggl.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBillable\u003c/strong\u003e sets Toggl's billable flag (for Toggl paid plans only).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" href=\"/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/blob/master/resources/readme/StreamDeckScreenshot.png\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/raw/master/resources/readme/StreamDeckScreenshot.png\" alt=\"StreamDeckScreenshot\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eJust press any Toggl Button to start tracking time. The button should indicate tracking by turning red and showing the current tracking time (if no \u003cem\u003eTitle\u003c/em\u003e is set). The status of the button is defined by workspace, project and entry name. If you setup two identical buttons (even on different Stream Deck profiles), both button indicate the same. If you start or stop your timer using the Toggl app (web, desktop, mobile) Toggl for Stream Deck will follow by changing the status.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e📞 Help\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content--help\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: 📞 Help\" href=\"#-help\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFeel free to ask your questions on \u003ca href=\"https://discord.gg/YWy3UAy\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003emy Discord Server\u003c/a\u003e. <div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Hassle-free time tracking using <a href="https://www.elgato.com/en/gaming/stream-deck" rel="nofollow">Elgato Stream Deck</a> and <a href="https://toggl.com/track/" rel="nofollow">Toggl Track</a></h1><a id="user-content-hassle-free-time-tracking-using-elgato-stream-deck-and-toggl-track" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Hassle-free time tracking using Elgato Stream Deck and Toggl Track" href="#hassle-free-time-tracking-using-elgato-stream-deck-and-toggl-track"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">✏️ Setup</h2><a id="user-content-️-setup" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: ✏️ Setup" href="#️-setup"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Just search for the Action "Toggl" within the Stream Deck app and install it. There is a button called "Toggl" available in section "Custom".</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/blob/master/resources/readme/PropertyInspector.png"><img src="/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/raw/master/resources/readme/PropertyInspector.png" alt="PropertyInspector" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>Title</strong> is a default Stream Deck property available for every button in Stream Deck. You should leave it empty (see Button Label).</li>
<li><strong>API Token</strong> is your private API Token you can get from your <a href="https://track.toggl.com/profile" rel="nofollow">Toggl profile</a>. This Token is handled like a password. <em><strong>Don't share it</strong></em>. Required.</li>
<li><strong>Button Label</strong> is used instead of <em>Title</em>. If the tracker isn't running, the Label is shown on the button. If the tracker is running the elapsed time is shown additionally. If <em>Title</em> is set, it will override <em>Button Label</em>.</li>
<li><strong>Entry Name</strong> describes the activity you want to report. It is not required but strongly recommended.</li>
<li><strong>Workspace</strong> is your workspace you start the time entries in. Required.</li>
<li><strong>Project</strong> is the project you want to assign the task to. Leave blank for no project. New projects can be added in Toggl.</li>
<li><strong>Billable</strong> sets Toggl's billable flag (for Toggl paid plans only).</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/blob/master/resources/readme/StreamDeckScreenshot.png"><img src="/tobimori/streamdeck-toggl/raw/master/resources/readme/StreamDeckScreenshot.png" alt="StreamDeckScreenshot" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<p dir="auto">Just press any Toggl Button to start tracking time. The button should indicate tracking by turning red and showing the current tracking time (if no <em>Title</em> is set). The status of the button is defined by workspace, project and entry name. If you setup two identical buttons (even on different Stream Deck profiles), both button indicate the same. If you start or stop your timer using the Toggl app (web, desktop, mobile) Toggl for Stream Deck will follow by changing the status.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">📞 Help</h2><a id="user-content--help" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: 📞 Help" href="#-help"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Feel free to ask your questions on <a href="https://discord.gg/YWy3UAy" rel="nofollow">my Discord Server</a>. Please use GitHub Issues for reporting bugs and requesting new features.</p>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Known Issues</h2><a id="user-content-known-issues" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Known Issues" href="#known-issues"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Changing the <em>Button Label</em> wont change the <em>Title</em> immediately. Restart Stream Deck.</li>
</ul>
